item.title: Trade-Offs and Synergies in Floodplain Management - A Historical-Ecological Approach
item.author: grixor@gmail.com (Trang Le)
item.description: I'm pretty pleased that my IGERT team's work has garnered both Judge's Choice and Community Choice awards in the [IGERT video and poster competition](http://posterhall.org/igert2012/posters/306). IGERT [(Integrative Graduate Education and Research Traineeship)](http://www.igert.org/) is a National Science Foundation program to foster interdisciplinary research at the graduate level. Here at UC Davis, [our team](http://reach.ucdavis.edu/people/trainees.html) includes ecologists and a historian, and we have been looking at how floodplain restoration can be shaped by both bioeconomic constraints and historical legacies.
